t: Ephesians 5
Be*p ye therefore followers of God, as dear children;
And*p walk in love, as Christ also hath loved us, and hath given himself for us an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.
But*p fornication, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not be once named among you, as becometh saints;
Neither*p filthiness, nor foolish talking, nor jesting, which are not convenient: but rather giving of thanks.
For*p this ye know, that no whoremonger, nor unclean person, nor covetous man, who is an idolater, hath any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.
Let*p no man deceive you with vain words: for because of these things cometh the wrath of God upon the children of disobedience.
Be*p not ye therefore partakers with them.
For*p ye were sometimes darkness, but now are ye light in the Lord: walk as children of light:
(For*p the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness and righteousness and truth;)
Proving*p what is acceptable unto the Lord.
And*p have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness, but rather reprove them.
For*p it is a shame even to speak of those things which are done of them in secret.
But*p all things that are reproved are made manifest by the light: for whatsoever doth make manifest is light.
Wherefore*p he saith, Awake thou that sleepest, and arise from the dead, and Christ shall give thee light.
See*p then that ye walk circumspectly, not as fools, but as wise,
Redeeming*p the time, because the days are evil.
Wherefore*p be ye not unwise, but understanding what the will of the Lord is.
And*p be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;
Speaking*p to yourselves in psalms and hymns and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in your heart to the Lord;
Giving*p thanks always for all things unto God and the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
Submitting*p yourselves one to another in the fear of God.
Wives,*p submit yourselves unto your own husbands, as unto the Lord.
For*p the husband is the head of the wife, even as Christ is the head of the church: and he is the saviour of the body.
Therefore*p as the church is subject unto Christ, so let the wives be to their own husbands in every thing.
Husbands,*p love your wives, even as Christ also loved the church, and gave himself for it;
That*p he might sanctify and cleanse it with the washing of water by the word,
That*p he might present it to himself a glorious church, not having spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing; but that it should be holy and without blemish.
So*p ought men to love their wives as their own bodies. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.
For*p no man ever yet hated his own flesh; but nourisheth and cherisheth it, even as the Lord the church:
For*p we are members of his body, of his flesh, and of his bones.
For*p this cause shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall be joined unto his wife, and they two shall be one flesh.
This*p is a great mystery: but I speak concerning Christ and the church.
Nevertheless*p let every one of you in particular so love his wife even as himself; and the wife see that she reverence her husband.
